thread.title: Franklin: Penn State can be "more aggressive,'' Barkley "awesome,'' at practice
thread.title_full: Franklin: Penn State can be "more aggressive,'' Barkley "awesome,'' at practice

author: MIKE GROSS | Sports Writer
title: Franklin: Penn State can be "more aggressive,'' Barkley "awesome,'' at practice
text:
Penn State coach James Franklin speaks to officials during a time out against Army. 
James Franklin met with the media for about 13 minutes after practice Wednesday. 
Not much news, although Franklin said freshman RB Saquon Barkley got reps during practice and looked "awesome.'' No determination has been made about the status of Barkley, or any of the injured Nittany Lions, for Saturday's game with Indiana. 
Franklin did expand a bit on his recent theme of managing his team's limitations, especially on offense. Penn State is ranked 117th on total offense among 125 FBS teams. 
"You talk about being more methodical; I think we need to be more aggressive at times,'' he said. 
"When you're struggling offensively, so much of the time you're trying to create a manageable third down situation that you become too conservative. ... You have to take a shot once in a while.'' 
The video, courtesy of gopsusports.com : Tags
